qas.question: What other species does migration help?

answers.text: ectoparasites such as ticks and lice

qas.question: What is a greater threat of disease transmission?

answers.text: import of pet and domestic birds

qas.question: What has been studied as a mechanism of disease transmission?
What has a role in the dispersal of propagules of plants and plankton?
What virus is maintained in birds without lethal effects?

context: The migration of birds also aids the movement of other species, including those of <a0_0>ectoparasites such as ticks and lice<a0_0/>, which in turn may carry micro-organisms including those of concern to human health. Due to the global spread of avian influenza, <a2_0>bird migration<a2_0/> has been studied as a possible mechanism of disease transmission, but it has been found not to present a special risk; <a1_0>import of pet and domestic birds<a1_0/> is a greater threat. Some viruses that are maintained in birds without lethal effects, such as the <a4_0>West Nile Virus<a4_0/> may however be spread by migrating birds. <a3_0>Birds<a3_0/> may also have a role in the dispersal of propagules of plants and plankton.
